title: 115_hr5800
content: The Act is titled the "Medicaid IMD ADDITIONAL INFO Act" and includes a provision for an exploratory study and report on mental disease institutions' requirements and practices under Medicaid. The Medicaid and CHIP Payment and Access Commission will conduct a study on mental disease institutions under Medicaid, including the number and types of facilities in each state. The study will include information on the facility types, coverage limitations, services provided, assessment process, discharge process, and any federal waivers for mental disease institutions under Medicaid in each state. The study will provide details on federal waivers and Medicaid funding sources used by states for mental disease institutions, as well as state requirements and standards for these institutions to receive payment under the state plan or waiver. The Medicaid and CHIP Payment and Access Commission will provide recommendations for improving care and standards in State Medicaid programs, including data collection improvements by the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services. Stakeholder input will be sought from State Medicaid directors, Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration, Medicaid beneficiary advocates, and others. In this section, definitions are provided for terms like "representative sample of States," "State," and "institution for mental diseases." The term "representative sample of States" refers to a non-probability sample of at least two States selected based on professional judgment. The term "State" includes the 50 States, the District of Columbia, and any commonwealth or territory of the United States. "Institution for mental diseases" is defined as per section 435.1009 of title 42. The House of Representatives passed the regulation on June 12, 2018, as per the Code of Federal Regulations. Karen L. Haas attested to it as the Clerk.
